name: Kappa
description: The Kappa is a small fey creature with a bowl-shaped indent on its head that holds water, embodying chaos and agility.
memorable: The Kappa can grapple creatures larger than itself and suffers significant penalties if its head bowl is emptied.
goals: Usually serves as a trickster in aquatic environments, causing chaos and engaging in physical contests.
relations: Often found near lakes or rivers and may interact with other fey creatures or aquatic beings.
environment: Typically found near lakes or rivers.
strengths: Possesses excellent physical strength and can effectively control opponents with grappling.
weaknesses: Vulnerable when its head bowl is empty, leading to disadvantages in combat.
attacks: Can make two claw attacks, dealing slashing damage and grappling larger foes.
most_powerful_ability: Expert Wrestler allows it to grapple larger creatures and maintain mobility while doing so.
senses: Passive Perception of 14 gives it good awareness of its surroundings.
skills: Proficient in Athletics, Medicine, Perception, and Stealth, enhancing its abilities in physical activities.
additional_information: Requires water in its head bowl to function at full capacity
Can breathe both air and water
Has advantage on escaping grapples and resisting being knocked prone
test_queries: small fey creature that lives by water
trickster monster with a water bowl on head
strong agile creature that grapples larger foes
chaotic water creature that suffers without water
